result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
2:10 pm - Defendant Troy Thomas Allen appeared by video, in custody, at New Lisbon Correctional.  Attorney Christopher T. Froelich appeared by video for Troy Thomas Allen.  Prosecuting attorney Gail Ann Prost appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives his/her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 1 for trial.  No inducement.

2:05 PM Defendant Troy Thomas Allen not in court.  Attorney Christopher T. Froelich not in court.  Attorney Gail Ann Prost appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty. Froelich did appear - but Defendant did not. Informed the Court that he did speak with New Lisbon Correctional and provided them with the ZOOM information.    Court calls the matter and finds good cause to extend time limits in which to conduct the preliminary examination.  
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.

2:36 pm - Prosecuting attorney Angelina R Scarpelli appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Troy Thomas Allen appeared by video, in custody at Dodge Correctional.  Deft has not received a copy of the complaint.  DA to mail to defendant.  Counsel is requested and defendant will be hiring his own.  Initial appearance is reset to 04-18-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 1.
